p: HCV not only can lead to kidney disease [ 6â€“ 12], but also contributes to increased morbidity and mortality in patients with established CKD [ 13]. Kidney transplantation is recognized as the renal replacement therapy of choice for eligible patients with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) [ 14]. Some studies have shown better survival in HCV-positive kidney transplant recipients than in HCV-positive patients with ESRD who are on dialysis [ 15]. The optimal immunosuppressive regimen in this group of patients remains uncertain [ 15].
